{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first step would be to assess the child's dental development. Since the complaint is about non-eruption of teeth, it is important to determine if the teeth are actually developing or if there is an underlying issue. One way to do this is by taking an OPG (Orthopantomogram) or a PA skull view, which can show the developing tooth buds. Another option would be to consult a pediatric dentist for further evaluation and guidance. However, before jumping to any treatment, it is also reasonable to wait and watch for some time, as delayed eruption of teeth can be a normal variation. Therefore, the treatment protocol would depend on the findings from the dental imaging and the assessment by a pediatric dentist.", "answer_choice": "D. Paediatric consultation"}
